# detailTextLabel

**Instance Property**

The secondary label of the table cell, if one exists.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var detailTextLabel: UILabel? { get }
```

## Discussion

Holds the secondary (or detail) label of the cell. `UITableViewCell` adds an appropriate label when you create the cell in a style that supports secondary labels. If the style doesn’t support detail labels, `nil` returns. See [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/CellStyle] for descriptions of the main label in currently defined cell styles.

This property is mutually exclusive with a content configuration. Setting a non-`nil` value for [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/contentConfiguration-9ktox] resets this property to `nil`.

## Related Documentation

- **init(style:reuseIdentifier:)**: Initializes a table cell with a style and a reuse identifier and returns it to the caller.

## Deprecated

- **textLabel**: The label to use for the main textual content of the table cell.
- **imageView**: The image view of the table cell.
